Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGRAVED
Name: Pitcher with the figure of Bes
Description: This clay vase, which has a single handle, comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Tell el-Yahudiya. It is part of the receptacles whose belly bears a representation of the head of Bes. The example is very particular: the facial features are marked with cuts, and by clay appliques. It dates from the Graeco-Roman Period.
